answers.author: Pamela Muse
answers.text:
Mark - the city of Aspen CO & Pitkin County co-share one website.  I believe the city maintains/manages/updates the websites for both.
Pam Muse
Alliance for Innovation
Pmuse@transformgov.org

answers.author: Barry Crook
answers.text:
Actually, while we share a website, content editing is a distributed function. PIOs for the city and county maintain the home pages (joint, city and county). For the city departmental pages have their own content editors. All content editors can seek some consulting from a central IT source, but they do not maintain the various pages. The county handles it the same way.

author: Mark Abeles-Allison
text: Does your community share web content with another city, village, town or county?  Maintaining up to date web information is a continuous effort.  I was wondering if any regions have designated a class or category of information that is shared across communities in a region on individual web pages?  I guess it could be as simple as having a google search with your communities name, show up on your web page as an updated article or link.  Do any communities do anything like this now?
title: Keeping your web page up to date
